name: The Heritage Golf and Spa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed in The Heritage for one nite with my wife and some friends. Being from the area, i am always anxious to show off this lovely resort.
reviews.title: Not quite a 5 star, but not far off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got an amazing deal on pigsback.com, Spa Experience, Dinner, B&B and room for €200 per couple.
reviews.title: A gem in Laois

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Hotel, Spa and Golf Course looks stunning and that foyer is amazing.
reviews.title: Below Par

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Spa Experience is excellent, couldn't fault it at all..and the Mud Chamber is interesting to say the least, but very relaxing!. The only thing that i would suggest is to make the relaxation area more luzurious and warmer (suggestion by our friends!)
reviews.title: Excellent Looking forward to our next visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had lunch in the bar and its well priced and very tasty. Ate in Sol O'Riens and was just a little disappointed..probably 7/10. Food was very good, but not amazing and several of our plates were brought out cold. Breakfast the next morning was 10/10.
reviews.title: Met and exceeded our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel and found the service to be very bad, there is an island behind the bar that the staff like to hide behind and getting a drink is a game of hide and seek. When I did get served after a long wait the glasses were dirty and when I asked for them to be changed i had to wait for glasses from the dishwasher , drinks in hot glasses was not what I would expect from a five star hotel. The breakfast well what breakfast it was every man for himself our food was just warm from the buffet which was running low and missing some things like eggs which we all enjoy for breakfast. No I think I wont be going back to the Heritage Golf and Spa Resort thanks.
reviews.title: three star at a five star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this would be a lovely hotel, and I was really looking forward to staying here but unfortunately it turned out to be a disaster! The room had a connecting door to the room beside it and we received an unwelcome drunk visitor. Ordered room service - club sandwich, it was terrible. Bar food wasnt great either. One good thing: the bathrooms were spotless as was the room. Staff at desk were ok, although I thought the staff who meet and greet were lovely. Views onto the golf course were fabulous. I would not recommend this to friends nor would I stay here again.
reviews.title: A Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here for one nite (thankfully) on a Saturday nite. A 5 Star it is not - at a push its a 3 star. We won't be returning.
reviews.title: A 5 Star it is not..a huge disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: On entering the hotel, the staircase is truly gorgeous, you could stand and look at its beauty for hours, its probably the nicest thing about the hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were nicely proportioned and warm. The staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Outstanding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst thing about the hotel was unequivocally the food. It was the rugby weekend. There was no tv in the hotel bar and we had to go to the golf club house to watch the match..we ordered a panini and the wrong sandwich came out even though the clubhouse was virtually empty. Dinner was in Greens which we didnt realise was also in the club house as the main restaurant in the hotel was fully booked out. When we asked if a certain wine was full bodied we were told that "yes it is a full bottle"! and that waitress didn't know but would check.
reviews.title: Friendliest Hotel in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in The Heritage for 1 night. Overall an ok stay at a decent rate but this place isn't 5 star by any stretch of the imagination.
reviews.title: Ok at the right price but definitely not 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Relaxing stay in a small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - Nice room with comfortable bed & spacious bathroom.
reviews.title: CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK
reflects well the state of the nation......in trouble....
reviews.text: - Good value deals on offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Nice spa with lots of sauna / steam room options to choose from.
reviews.title: Five Star??????????????????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner, who is six months pregnant with our second child, and I decided to take a weekend away (thurs-fri, just the two of us) before our new arrival and I have to say it did us the world of good. We chose the heritage on the recomendation of a friend, trip advisor and also because we managed to get a fantastic deal. So much so in fact that we decided to upgrade our room to a junior suite (€100 extra) which was simply fab. Proper five star luxury that was €100 extra well spent.
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered, couldn't have asked for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel bar the first night as the Sol Oriens restaurant was fully booked and the food was as you would expect from bar food although their chunky chips were a bit too chunky for my liking. I tried to book Sol Oriens for the following night and again was told it was fully booked. I was a bit disappointed by this as we weren't looking to go off site for dinner. The receptionist did take our details and when we arrived for breakfast the following morning told us that she had got us a reservation for that night. Having eaten there I now see why it was fully booked. Sol Oriens is a lovely restaurant with good, reasonably priced food and a great atmosphere. There is also a pub next door called the Thatch which plays live music
reviews.title: Not the 5 star experience it once was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was not our reason for going there however. I am a keen golfer and my wife never needs to be asked twice to go to a spa. I booked a round of golf for the friday morning and Rachel booked into the spa for a massage and a manicure. As I was on my own the golf manager hooked me up with one of the GC members which was great as he was able to show me round the course which i have to say is fantastic. For february the greens were in immaculate condition.
reviews.title: fantistic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After my golf I met with Rachel in the spa. I bought their "spa experience" which was €20 and allows you access to their steam/dry/wet rooms and sauna etc and was a lovely way to relax after golf.
reviews.title: The good and the bad...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reading this back it probably is a little long winded but I have used trip advisor for a number hotel/city breaks and find it an invaluable research tool. With this in mind if I can help others as they have helped me then all the better and I have to say, taking everyting into account the Heritage is most definitely one of the better places I have stayed in Ireland and would absolutely recommend it to anyone
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a visit to The Heritage - overall it was quite good, but I have to say this is not a true 5 star hotel. I really do not know how it gets that rating.
reviews.title: Not a 5 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get my wrong, there were alot of great things about this hotel - the bedrooms were gorgeous - great amenities, spacious,quiet, lovely views of the golf course. The Italian restaurant is exceptionally good value for money, great food, had a great atmosphere the night we were there and great service. The golf course is excellent, and the concierge/front desk staff were professional, friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Wonderful Heritage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However there were just too many things which made it fall short of a true 5 star hotel. Firstly, no turn down service or mini bar in the rooms. Secondly, breakfast was very poor - buffet style, but not very good - horrible watery scrambled eggs, overdone sausages, greasy mushrooms - in my view a 5 star hotel breakfast should be served to you, not buffet style, and if it is going to be buffet, make it good!! We had a few drinks in The Thatch Pub after dinner - could not believe that it was not possible to charge drinks to your room. In a 5 star hotel?! And they didn't give cashback on Laser - extremely inconvenient. The glasses were dirty and drinks served were not acceptable - 2 cubes of ice at the most and no lemon/lime in the shorts. Same in the bar in the hotel - drinks just not presented to a 5 star standard. Also had bar food here and it was "just ok" - but as my husband said, when you know you could make nicer at home yourself, and you're paying 5 star prices, that's not good.
reviews.title: Little Piece of Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is lovely but very pricey. In this current economic climate they need to be more competitive and offer value for money.
reviews.title: Relaxevou!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was just ok - nothing spectacular, and I wouldn't return - it's a good 4 star hotel but certainly not up to 5 star standards - we recently visited Mount Juliet in Kilkenny - now that is true 5 star. The Heritage could learn a thing or two from them.
reviews.title: not 5 star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had heard a lot of my golfer friends speak very highly of The Heritage so we decided to take a weekend break and stay at this 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Not Deserving of its 5 Star Status

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Don’t get me wrong, this isn’t a bad hotel but it’s certainly not a 5 star hotel, I presume it has received this status as a result of the golf course and health spa. The check-in staff weren’t very welcoming, in fact, mid way through our check-in the lady who was serving us took off without any explanation to help her colleagues with some other guests. No apology was given to us either when eventually she did return.
reviews.title: Spoiling ouselves!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room itself was fine; no mini bar which I thought strange as any other 5 star hotels I’ve stayed in have always had that temptation around the television area! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room ultra dark, perfect for a good night’s sleep! The corridor noise was clearly audible in the rooms, luckily it was a quiet night in the hotel so it didn’t bother us too much. The bathroom was very spacious and not short on toiletries.
reviews.title: 18 hours of pure bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast was very disappointing; we came down mid way through the breakfast serving and found the buffet of the traditional Irish to be almost cold. We had to ask for tea and coffee as we sat for a number of minutes without, I didn’t see any orange juice either, unless you also had to ask for this? The porridge was very watery and the toast was cold and very doughy, it was barely toasted.
reviews.title: The most welcoming, friendly & helpful staff you could wish for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don’t feel this hotel deserves the top rating, it’s a good hotel but when something is branded as being a 5 star, you expect the best. It’s certainly lacking the little extras that 5 star hotels are providing.
reviews.title: Not a 5 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here with my wife for 3 day mid week break on a golf package. Very welcoming and provided an excellent 5* sevice. The food in the Arlington restaurant was superb.
reviews.title: excellent friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: The golf course is a good test with water on a number of holes. The greens are championship standard. There is also a par3 course which good fun and worth playing.
reviews.title: Not 5 star service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is extensive and relaxing but rather over priced I thought by comparison.
reviews.title: I've stayed in cleaner 3 stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Will be staying there again soon I hope
reviews.title: enjoyable night away

likes.liked: — Fab bathroom with separate double power shower and deep roll top bath, bath robes and slippers provided
likes.disliked: — Smell of sewage when entering bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We didn't stay in the hotel itself, but in one of the apartments - which are priced the same as the hotel rooms, but the girl on reservations told me the apt rooms are a superior standard to the ordinary hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Great staff, nice hotel, but not 5 star

likes.disliked: — large buildings seems out of place for a rural setting

reviews.title: You MUST do the "Spa Experiance"
reviews.text: Booked a two night B&B +1 dinner deal with hotel. This was our Christmas gift to each other. We had such a lovely time here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009
reviews.text: There was a difficulty with our room AC and it was sorted out within five minutes with no hassle, we were moved to another room immediately (luckily for us, the only room available was a suite overlooking the golf course!) Both rooms were tastfully decorated and well thought out in terms of space and comfort and finished to a high specification.
reviews.title: more than a five star!!!!

likes.liked: — the lovely staff and fantastic food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had lunch in the main front bar, which was delicious. Ate in the Italian that evening, it was absolutely gorgeous. I know very little about Italian food, but it was delicious.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

likes.liked: — It was lovely and clean and had lovely grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the spa the following day, had the Spa Experience with a midweek package. I really did wonder how I'd spend three hours wandering from hot rooms to cold showers but it was divine and was sorry to leave it, if you visit, you must do this! Also treated myself to a body polish, facial and massage. Can highly recommend therapist, Grace. It was not just a fancy back rub and a quick face patting as it can be in some places, but great technique and made a real difference, (thank you!)
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: We ate that evening in the fine dining Arlington Room, which was lovely. Tasted food that I wouldn't normally go for so it was an experience in itself.
reviews.title: Lovely Break
